original: Source: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007 the PSM in each Property, solely for the purpose of developing the wireless applications specifically set forth for each of the Properties on Exhibits B through M attached hereto ( “Wireless Products” ), some of which Wireless Products are defined in the Glossary attached hereto as Exhibit N. To the extent not specified in this Agreement the parties will agree upon the specific Wireless Products to be developed for each Property in accordance with the procedure set forth in Paragraph 2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Licensee acknowledges that it shall be obligated to develop all Wireless Products set forth on Exhibits B, C, D, and G, and any other Wireless Products for other Properties that the parties mutually agree in writing will be added to the VGSL Agreement for distribution by VGSL (the  “VGSL Products” ). The Wireless Products shall utilize elements of the PSM and shall be operated on mobile or cellular telephones. Furthermore, Fox grants to Licensee a limited, exclusive (except as may otherwise be provided in this Agreement), non-transferable (except as permitted in Paragraph 17(d)) right and license to make, have made, reproduce, modify, create derivative works of, advertise, promote, distribute, sell and license the Wireless Products, including any PSM included therein, solely (i) for use on mobile or cellular telephones (the  “Wireless Platform” ); (ii) in the Territory (as defined in Paragraph 3), (iii) during the Term (as defined in Paragraph 4), (iv) for distribution by Licensee through the Distribution Channels (as defined in Paragraph 2(c)) granted herein; and (v) by means of periodic subscription fee, a per-download basis, or through a retail purchase. Source: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007, the PSM in each Property, primarily for the purpose of creating wireless applications specifically outlined for each Property as detailed in Exhibits B through M attached ( "Wireless Products" ), some of which Wireless Products are defined in the Glossary attached as Exhibit N. The parties will agree on the specific Wireless Products to be developed for each Property, unless otherwise specified in this Agreement or mutually agreed upon in writing, in accordance with the procedure set forth in Paragraph 2. However, it is important to note that while Licensee acknowledges its responsibility to create all Wireless Products listed on Exhibits B, C, D, and G, as well as any additional Wireless Products for other Properties that may be added to the VGSL Agreement and agreed upon by both parties for distribution by VGSL (the "VGSL Products" ), there is no obligation for Licensee to develop these products unless explicitly stated in a written agreement.

The Wireless Products shall incorporate aspects of the PSM and function on mobile or cellular telephones. Fox grants to Licensee a limited, exclusive (except as may otherwise be provided in this Agreement), non-transferable (except as permitted in Paragraph 17(d)) right and license to manufacture, reproduce, modify, derive works from, market, promote, distribute, sell, and sublicense the Wireless Products, including any PSM included therein. This authorization is limited to (i) use on mobile or cellular telephones (the "Wireless Platform" ), (ii) within the defined Territory as stated in Paragraph 3, (iii) during the agreed Term as specified in Paragraph 4, (iv) for distribution by Licensee through the Distribution Channels granted herein, and (v) via periodic subscription fee, per-download basis, or retail purchase. It is important to clarify that this agreement does not grant Licensee the right to create and/or distribute video clips and/or trailers for the Properties unless explicitly agreed upon by Fox in writing.

original: (b) Bundling : Neither party will solicit or enter into any agreement with any third party regarding the bundling of the Wireless Products with any other property (including a Fox property) or with any other products and services including preloading, OEM and soft bundling, except as mutually agreed between the parties. original: Source: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007 approved use of the music from the Property in connection with the Wireless Products, including without limitation any royalties, mechanical fees, residuals, publishing fees, license fees, reuse fees or other guild-related payments. Clause:
Source: GLU MOBILE INC, S-1/A, 3/19/2007
Regarding the utilization of music from the Property in association with the Wireless Products, GLU MOBILE INC agrees to pay any royalties, mechanical fees, residuals, publishing fees, license fees, reuse fees, or other guild-related payments due to Fox Music. However, it is noted that the rate for such royalty payments will be determined by the mutual agreement between GLU MOBILE INC and Fox Music.

Furthermore, while obtaining the prior written approval of Fox Music regarding the final music arrangement remains important, GLU MOBILE INC shall only provide one sample of the final, approved Wireless Product to Fox Music after the sale or distribution has occurred.

This modification in the clause aims to shift the responsibility for royalty payments from the Licensee (GLU MOBILE INC) to the original copyright holder (Fox Music), while maintaining the need for prior approval from Fox Music for the final music arrangement.

In this revised clause, I have attempted to make the clause more user-friendly by altering its structure and rephrasing certain elements to provide more clarity regarding the parties' choices and rights. The key changes are:

1. Changed "This Agreement shall be construed" to "This Agreement will adhere to" for a slightly less binding tone.
2. Added "at the discretion of the instigating party" to reflect that either party may choose which court to bring a dispute before.
3. Restructured the clause to present the consequences (disputes being brought before certain courts) first and then the parties' obligations (consenting to jurisdiction, waiving objections, and serving process according to California law). This should make it clearer that these are the potential outcomes of a dispute rather than conditions for the agreement itself.
4. Changed "The parties hereto irrevocably submit to" to "The parties herein consent to," signifying that this is an act of will and can potentially be revoked in certain circumstances (although the clause still contains a waiver of objections to forum suitability, which may not be easily revoked).
5. Changed "Service of process shall be" to "Notifications of legal proceedings shall be served," as it is more descriptive and emphasizes that the service of process refers only to court summons or other official notifications rather than all forms of communication in the context of the agreement.

original: (h) Limitation of Actions:  No legal action shall be brought by Licensee under this Agreement unless commenced within 12 months from the date the cause of action arose.
ollama_generated: (h) Time Limit for Claims: Any claim made by the Licensor under this Agreement must be initiated within 12 months from the date the relevant event occurred, or else it shall be deemed waived and barred.

original: COLLECTION The News America Group obtains personally identifiable information only if we believe the information is relevant to our relationship with a consumer or to assist us in creating a relationship with a consumer. We obtain personally identifiable information about consumers directly from consumers whenever possible, primarily in the course of providing them with products, information and services. When the News America Group obtains personally identifiable information from third-party sources, we use only reputable sources. In those instances where our information collection activities involve children, the News America Group provides special privacy protections.
ollama_generated: DATA COLLECTION: The News America Group may gather personally identifiable information to enhance or establish a relationship with a consumer, not limited to situations where we deem such information as potentially relevant. We strive to collect such data directly from consumers when feasible, typically during the provision of our products, information, and services. On occasions where we acquire personally identifiable information from external sources, we ensure these sources are trustworthy. In cases where our data collection processes concern children, The News America Group implements additional privacy safeguards. However, it is important to note that while we make every effort to ensure the accuracy and security of the data we collect, consumers bear some responsibility for providing correct information and maintaining its confidentiality.
